Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with two added white bands; exterior reserved save for trace of single brown band; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The lack of decoration on either side of the sherd may be a result of the sherd's size. The decoration on either side of Simple Animal Style vases is not usually extensive and filling ornament, with the exception of a simple rim pattern, a single elaborate rosette and simple handle zone pattern, is absent. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have very little decoration as well. 'ɸ' is written in pencil and '20' on a label on the interior surface of the sherd. '20' is written in pencil on the exterior surface.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 21.1.15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1494) (phase 2)
